Package ludo

Class Token

  • java.lang.Object
    • ludo.Token

  • public class Token
extends java.lang.Object
    The token represents the tokens that can be moved along the route. Each player can have four tokens. They can leave and enter squares and move along the route. When a Token reaches the ending square, it is finished and cannot be moved anymore.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Used to check if this token is finished.

      Sets the token to a specific square.

    • Method Detail

      • checkFinished

        public boolean checkFinished​()
        Used to check if this token is finished.
        Returns:
        true, if the token is on the ending square and therefore finished.

      • finish

        public void finish​()
        Makes the token know it finished the game and stands on th end square.

      • moveForward

        public void moveForward​(int fields)
        Makes the token move some fields forward along its route.
        Parameters:
        fields - The amount of fields to move the token forward along its route.

      • moveTo

        public void moveTo​(ISquare moveToSquare)
        Sets the token to a specific square.
        Parameters:
        moveToSquare - The square the token is wished to go.

      • sendHome

        public void sendHome​()
        Sends this token back to the home. This happens if another token lands on the same field as this one.

      • getPlayer

        public Player getPlayer​()
        Used to get the Player of the token.
        Returns:
        The player this token belongs to.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString​()
        Representation of the Token. Used to render the board.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        R, if the token belongs to red player G, if the token belongs to green player Y, if the token belongs to yellow player B, if the token belongs to blue player

        public ISquare getSquare​()
